name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation
mission: PROVIDE SHELTER,CLOTHING,FOOD TO POOR AND THE NEEDY PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: Critical source 'website' failed: No data found on any pages
Extremely high working capital (120.5 months) may indicate hoarding or data error

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc earns 54/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The charity reported total revenue of $5,752,945, a 95.1% program expense ratio, and manages the High Ways Project.
The organization holds 120.5 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high program spending, balanced against a lack of third-party impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics for its programs.
Narrow program diversity, with a heavy focus on the High Ways Project and basic relief.

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Sadaqah-eligible entity, the foundation aligns well with donors seeking to support urgent humanitarian causes and infrastructure in underserved regions [1]. Its track record is established through significant international relief efforts, though its specific fit for Muslim donors is categorized as medium due to the focus on general charitable giving [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a direct provision model, utilizing 95.1% of its $5,752,945 revenue for program services such as the 25-kilometer High Ways Project [1]. While its financial health is strong with 120.5 months of working capital, specific data regarding the long-term effectiveness of its interventions remains limited [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides essential humanitarian relief and infrastructure support to vulnerable populations globally.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 95.1%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Robust financial stability with 120.5 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Operating as a Sadaqah-eligible organization, the foundation focuses on providing food, clothing, and shelter to the needy while managing specialized infrastructure projects [1]. In the most recent fiscal period, the charity reported a total revenue of $5,752,945 to support its international mission [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high program spending, balanced against a lack of third-party impact verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently has <cite id="2">no beneficiary data available</cite>, making it difficult to assess the cost-effectiveness of its food and shelter programs.

With <cite id="2">120.5 months of working capital</cite>, the charity holds funds far beyond the standard 1-120.5 months of working capital, suggesting potential for greater immediate deployment of resources.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization has not been formally evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The foundation's long history since 1991 provides some institutional assurance despite modern data gaps.
risk_factors: <cite id="2">No external evaluation or outcome tracking</cite> for 3+ years
<cite id="2">Excessive working capital</cite> may indicate under-utilization of available funds
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="2">lack of verified outcomes</cite> and a formal theory of change, which limits the ability to measure actual social return on investment.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly consistent across sources.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the financial integrity of the foundation due to its <cite id="2">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a board consisting of <cite id="2">95.1% independent members</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation should <cite id="2">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current 4 members to enhance oversight diversity.

impact.explanation: The foundation utilizes a <cite id="2">direct provision model</cite>, ensuring that <cite id="2">95.1% of expenses</cite> reach program activities like the High Ways Project.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="2">tracking and reporting beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a clear cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Financial transparency without outcome data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct provision of services rather than third-party grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides essential humanitarian relief and infrastructure support to vulnerable populations globally.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize low overhead and want their entire contribution to reach the field through a legacy humanitarian brand.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 95.1% of their Sadaqah goes directly to program expenses
Value the historical legacy of the Edhi name in Pakistan
Prefer organizations with zero fundraising costs
Are comfortable with established relief models over new experimental programs
giving_considerations: The organization holds very high cash reserves relative to its spending
Detailed impact reports with specific numbers of people served are not currently public
Focus is primarily on basic relief (food, shelter) rather than systemic change
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking rigorous, data-heavy impact evaluations or those specifically looking to fulfill Zakat obligations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="2">unverified evidence and outcomes</cite> despite high financial transparency.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation operates on the principle that direct provision of food, clothing, and shelter immediately alleviates the suffering of the needy.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that 95.1% program expense translates into 95.1% effective relief for the poor.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While reserves are high, the <cite id="2">-4.0% revenue CAGR</cite> suggests a need for renewed donor engagement to sustain growth.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Maintains a <cite id="2">100.0% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="2">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and size

strengths.detail: The foundation directs <cite id="2">95.1% of its expenses to programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="2">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
The organization operates with <cite id="2">$0.00 fundraising efficiency</cite>, meaning no donor funds are diverted to professional solicitation.
The charity maintains <cite id="2">120.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing extreme long-term financial stability.

strengths_deep_dive: The foundation's financial health is characterized by a massive reserve of net assets, which grew to <cite id="1">$27,402,805 by the end of 2023</cite>. This represents a significant increase from <cite id="1">$17,964,339 in 2021</cite>, showcasing a strong balance sheet. Furthermore, the organization operates with <cite id="2">95.1% independent board members</cite>, ensuring that governance is not compromised by internal conflicts of interest. This combination of high liquidity and independent oversight provides a stable platform for its <cite id="1">international humanitarian mission</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc operates as a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">shelter, clothing, and food to the poor</cite> and needy globally. In the 2023 fiscal year, the foundation reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $5,752,945</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="1">$5,699,902 in public contributions</cite>. The organization is distinguished by its lean operational model, maintaining a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 95.1%</cite>, which indicates that all reported functional expenses are directed toward its core mission. Based in New York, the foundation serves as an international arm of the legacy established by Abdul Sattar Edhi, focusing its efforts on <cite id="2">vulnerable populations in Pakistan</cite>. Despite its significant asset base, including <cite id="1">$27,427,805 in total assets</cite>, the organization maintains a remarkably low overhead, reporting <cite id="2">$0.00 spent on fundraising</cite> for every dollar raised. This financial structure allows the foundation to focus on direct provision, though it currently lacks a published theory of change or detailed outcome tracking to verify the long-term efficacy of its relief efforts.
